intro: Scaevola oleoides, commonly known as the silver scabiosa, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its silver-gray, fuzzy foliage and clusters of small, sky-blue or white flowers. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family and is often grown as an ornamental due to its striking appearance. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Scaevola oleoides is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
